definition: clamor/noise/(bound form) sound used to call cats
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: By the time of his death, even the once-loyal Army was starting to mutiny over low pay.
sentences.chinese: 他逝世后，曾一度忠诚的军队因为低收入而哗变。

sentences.english: Failure to obey orders on a ship is mutiny.
sentences.chinese: 在船上不执行命令就是哗变。

sentences.english: A mutiny have take place off the coast of south america.
sentences.chinese: 在南美洲海岸外的舰艇上发生了一次哗变。

sentences.english: A mutiny took place in the capital of that country.
sentences.chinese: 该国首都发生了军事哗变。

sentences.english: The mutiny in the Greek Brigade was also approaching a crisis.
sentences.chinese: 希腊旅中的哗变形势，也正在发展为一种危机。

sentences.english: A mutiny has taken place off the coast of South america.
sentences.chinese: 在南美洲海岸外的舰艇上发生了一次哗变。

sentences.english: In other words, you fear a mutiny.
sentences.chinese: 换言之，你怕发生一场哗变。

sentences.english: Mutiny, it was plain, hung over us like a thunder-cloud.
sentences.chinese: 显然，哗变像块雷雨前的乌云一般笼罩在我们上方。

definition: mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
to serve the king diligently/to save the country in times of danger/to send troops to rescue the king
to put down a revolt/to pacify a rebellion
against orders/to disobey/to refuse to accept orders
